abstract: Over 150 photographic prints (mostly 4x6 cabinet size, mounted on cardstock) taken by noted Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler, dating circa 1870-1887 and depicting Northwestern University faculty, students, and buildings. The collection includes 2 copies of the published volume Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
folder_name: Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston [2 copies]
project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11723'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
subject: Illinois--Evanston|Street photography|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Photographs|Buildings

Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. University Edition (Class of 1877)

abstract: Over 150 photographic prints (mostly 4x6 cabinet size, mounted on cardstock) taken by noted Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler, dating circa 1870-1887 and depicting Northwestern University faculty, students, and buildings. The collection includes 2 copies of the published volume Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11721'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. W.G. Evans (Class of 1877)

Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11721'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. W.G. Evans (Class of 1877)
subject: Illinois--Evanston|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Photographs|College students

scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

abstract: Over 150 photographic prints (mostly 4x6 cabinet size, mounted on cardstock) taken by noted Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler, dating circa 1870-1887 and depicting Northwestern University faculty, students, and buildings. The collection includes 2 copies of the published volume Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11721'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. W.G. Evans (Class of 1877)

Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
subject: Illinois--Evanston|Teachers|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Photographs

project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11717'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
subject: Illinois--Evanston|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Fisk, H. F. (Herbert Franklin), 1840-1916|College students|Photographs
terms_of_use: The images on this web site are from material in the collections of the University Archives of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

title: Cutler, F.H.

abstract: Over 150 photographic prints (mostly 4x6 cabinet size, mounted on cardstock) taken by noted Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler, dating circa 1870-1887 and depicting Northwestern University faculty, students, and buildings. The collection includes 2 copies of the published volume Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
folder_name: Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston [2 copies]
project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11723'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. William Henry Wait (Class of 1879)
subject: Illinois--Evanston|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Photographs|College students

Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11721'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. Earll, R.E. (Class of 1877)
subject: Illinois--Evanston|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Photographs|College students

Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11718'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. Class of 1879 (University Edition)
subject: Illinois--Evanston|Evanston Life Saving Station (U.S.)|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Photographs|College campuses|Buildings

Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. University Edition (Class of 1879)
subject: Illinois--Evanston|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Photographs|College students

scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

title: Life Saving Station

abstract: Over 150 photographic prints (mostly 4x6 cabinet size, mounted on cardstock) taken by noted Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler, dating circa 1870-1887 and depicting Northwestern University faculty, students, and buildings. The collection includes 2 copies of the published volume Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11720'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. C.W. Thornton (Class of 1877)

title: Logan, C.L.

abstract: Over 150 photographic prints (mostly 4x6 cabinet size, mounted on cardstock) taken by noted Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler, dating circa 1870-1887 and depicting Northwestern University faculty, students, and buildings. The collection includes 2 copies of the published volume Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
folder_name: Class of 1878: Karcher, Louis - Kinman, Edward Morgan
project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11716'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).

project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11720'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. University Edition (Class of 1877)
subject: Illinois--Evanston|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Photographs|College students

Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. University Edition (Class of 1879)
subject: Illinois--Evanston|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)|Photographs|College students

title: Pomeroy, M.L.

abstract: Over 150 photographic prints (mostly 4x6 cabinet size, mounted on cardstock) taken by noted Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler, dating circa 1870-1887 and depicting Northwestern University faculty, students, and buildings. The collection includes 2 copies of the published volume Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11717'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. Class of 1880 (University Edition)

Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. University Edition (Class of 1877)

project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11717'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. Class of 1880 (University Edition)
subject: Illinois--Evanston|College students|Photographs|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.)
terms_of_use: The images on this web site are from material in the collections of the University Archives of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. title: Photographic views of Picturesque Evanston, state of Illinois. Newspaper clippings found within Photographic views of Picturesque Evanston.

abstract: Over 150 photographic prints (mostly 4x6 cabinet size, mounted on cardstock) taken by noted Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler, dating circa 1870-1887 and depicting Northwestern University faculty, students, and buildings. The collection includes 2 copies of the published volume Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
project: {'cycle': '2016', 'desc': None, 'manager': 'Nicole Finzer', 'name': 'Alexander Hesler Photo Collection', 'proposer': None, 'task_number': 'Job:11719'}
scope_and_contents: The series consists of approximately one hundred and fifty photographic prints made by Evanston, Illinois, photographer Alexander Hesler during the 1870s and 1880s. Most of the prints are portraits of Northwestern University faculty, administrators, and students. Also included are a number of photographs of class and student groups, University buildings, and portraits of Northwestern University Preparatory School students. Most of the prints are mounted on cardboard stock and range in size from approximately 4" x 6" to 4-1/2" x 7". Prints of buildings and student groups are sorted into alphabetically-arranged topics. Portraits of Northwestern faculty and administrators are arranged alphabetically by the subjects’ surnames. Portraits of students are arranged by their class year (year of graduation; for example, Class of 1878, Class of 1879, etc.) When multiple portraits exist for a given year they are alphabetized within folders by students’ surnames. Unidentified or partially identified portraits are at the end of the series. The series includes two copies of Hesler’s book, Photographic Views of Picturesque Evanston (1887).
source: Class Photograph Albums. University Edition (Class of 1879)
